meanings.definition: Hit forcefully with the hand or a hard object.
meanings.sent1: He clouted the ball with all his might.
meanings.sent2: She clouted the door shut in anger.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat clouted the toy off the table.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouted the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The boxer clouted his opponent with a powerful punch.

meanings.definition: Covered or patched with a piece of cloth or leather.
meanings.sent1: She wore clouted shoes to protect her feet.
meanings.sent2: The clouted jacket kept him warm in the cold weather.
meanings.sent3: The clouted umbrella looked mismatched but kept her dry.
meanings.sent4: The clouted bag had seen better days, but it was still functional.
meanings.sent5: The clouted hat had a unique style, attracting many compliments.
